thread.title: What’s on TV this week: from drama to reality and docos and beyond
thread.title_full: What’s on TV this week: from drama to reality and docos and beyond | dailytelegraph.com.au

author: Shannon Molloy National TV Writer
title: What’s on TV this week: from drama to reality and docos and beyond
text:
ACROSS the free-to-air networks and subscription television channels, there are hundreds and hundreds of options when it comes to what to watch on the box.
We’ve waded through the listings to find the shows worth watching each night, from local and international drama to documentary and reality, and beyond.
This is your special guide to the seven shows you simply can’t miss — with a few trashy bonus extras thrown in for good measure.
Grand master ... Kevin McCloud follows the construction of amazing homes, from initial idea to end result. Picture: Chris Scott Source: News Limited
GRAND DESIGNS
It’s a show about people building spectacular homes, usually over budget and well past schedule. Architectural guru Kevin McCloud this week patiently follows the ambition of a couple who clearly have too much money. Their plans to build an “urban shed” out of corrugated cement fibre board in the middle of London get out of hand — not least because they’re doing stuff without the approval of authorities. Cue drama. Sunday, 7.40pm, ABC
Honourable mention for guilty pleasure viewing: Webcam Girls on ABC2 on Sunday at 11.30pm. Delve into the world of adult entertainment with an inside look at the women who ‘perform’ via webcam for an online audience.
Inside look ... Caitlyn Jenner is one of the most talked about women in the world right now. Picture: Supplied Source: Supplied
I AM CAIT
I got a sneak peek at the first episode of this documentary reality series, and it’s good. Yes, there are Kardashians involved, but unlike their shows, this is real. It’s very raw, emotional and in depth. Very little seems off limits. And Caitlyn Jenner is one of the most talked about people in the world right now, so it’s utterly fascinating. This series begins in the days after Caitlyn introduced herself via that now famous Vanity Fair cover. Monday, 9.30pm, E!
Honourable mention for guilty pleasure viewing: Ramsay’s Hotel Hell on Seven on Monday at 8.30pm. I don’t know what makes chef Gordon Ramsay qualified to critique awful hotels ... but in any case, it’s compelling viewing. And he’s just as sweary and short-tempered as always.
Incredible journey ... a group of Aussies retrace the steps of refugees. Picture: Supplied Source: SBS
GO BACK TO WHERE YOU CAME FROM
Six ordinary Aussie with various different views about refugees go on an extraordinary journey to better understand the issue. As this special three-night TV event kicks off, the experiment participants move in with a group who were one ‘boat people’ and prepare to retrace the steps they took to get to this country. Tuesday, 8.30pm, SBS
Honourable mention for guilty pleasure viewing: Embarrassing Bodies Down Under on Nine on Tuesday at 9pm. I once had a mole on my stomach that I was super selfconscious about. After watching this show, I don’t know why I was ever bothered.
Hopefuls ... five teams will battle it out for dining glory in Restaurant Revolution. Source: Channel 7
RESTAURANT REVOLUTION
Yes, it’s another cooking reality TV show ... but this one is a bit different to the rest. It follows five teams as they turn an empty shipping container into a pop-up restaurant, serving hundreds of regular punters. Whoever makes the most successful business will win a grand cash prize, which they can use to make their hospitality dreams come true. Wednesday, 7.30pm, Seven
Honourable mention for guilty pleasure viewing: How Drugs Work on Wednesday on ABC2 at 9.20pm. What happens when someone smokes cannabis? This program answers that question, showing the mind-warping and heart-racing effects.
Mystery unfolds ... Glitch is a great Aussie drama with an interesting story. Source: Supplied
GLITCH
The mysterious story continues to unfold, as a group of once-dead and now very alive people struggle to understand why they’re suddenly back in the land of the living. But it’s increasingly clear there’s more going on here, as a country cop turns super weird. What’s he up to? We’ll find out eventually, I guess. The pace of this series is all over the shop and I’m starting to lose interest again, but we’ve come this far, so ... Thursday, 8.30pm, ABC
Honourable mention for guilty pleasure viewing: The Bachelor Australia on Thursday on Ten at 7.30pm. On the one hand, this show makes me uncomfortable ... it’s a bunch of girls vying for the ‘love’ of one bloke. On the other hand, the cray cray drama that unfolds makes great TV.
These guys ... the infectious energy and chemistry of The Living Room team only makes it more enjoyable to watch. Source: Supplied
THE LIVING ROOM
Even if you’re not handy around the house, this show is fun to watch. It’s kind of like eating take-out while watching a cooking program. Tonight, there’s a garden transformation, a delicious bacon and egg pie, and a sticky beak inside the glorious home of Violent Femmes bassist Brian Ritche. Friday, 7.30pm, Ten
Honourable mention for guilty pleasure viewing: If You Are The One on Friday on SBS2 at 6.30pm. Seriously, you have to give this a go if you’ve not already. It’s a Chinese dating game show.
Weird and wonderful ... Celebrity Chef is a Chinese reality TV show that makes for entertaining viewing. Source: Supplied
CELEBRITY CHEF
I was going to put this down as a ‘guilty pleasure’ show but there’s actually some substance here, among the fair dose of odd that you’d expect from a Chinese reality TV show. Basically, a bunch of local celebs — all massive foodies — are tutored by a Michelin-star chef ahead of a serious of studio-based culinary challenges. The tasks are epic and the food looks delicious. Saturday, 6.10pm, SBS2
Honourable mention for guilty pleasure viewing: Caught Red-Handed on Saturday on CI Network at 5.30pm. Watch as a variety of intricate stings nab criminals up to a whole host of naughty deeds. And it’s not just the police setting traps — a few ordinary people are also on the hunt for crooks.
What do you think? What’s your favourite show on television at the moment? Share your thoughts in the comment section below.
 The best shows on TV this week
